Football.title: Crystal Palace 2 Zrinjski 0 (3-1 on agg): Lacroix and Guessand seal Eagles’ spot in Conference League last 16
Football.content:
CRYSTAL PALACE’S European adventure is still going as they limped their way one step closer to Leipzig.

The Eagles started the Conference League as favourites and remain the bookies’ top picks despite needing an unconvincing play-off second-leg win over Bosnian outfit Zrinjski Mostar just to reach the last 16.





But a piece of Adam Wharton wizardry and Maxence Lacroix’s thumping header nine minutes before half-time, then Evann Guessand’s late, late clincher, means they are, most importantly, in the draw, where they will get either Mainz or Larnaca, the Cypriots who stunned Palace in South London in October.

This was plodding Palace creeping not cruising their way through at Selhurst Park – and it certainly was not pretty despite bossing the stats.

Oliver Glasner made three changes from the drab first leg in Bosnia.

Crucially, though, Lacroix was not one of them, the lynchpin defender passed fit after hobbling off in Mostar and missing Sunday’s Wolves win, only their second in 16 matches.

Despite the doom and gloom, the possibility of a fourth penalty shootout this season and his approaching exit, the Austrian was all smiles on his way to the dugout, even posing for photos for some fans.

But there was not a whole lot on the pitch making him happy as Jorgen Strand Larsen’s ambitious strike deflected harmlessly wide and Jaydee Canvot picked up an early yellow.

Evann Guessand started brightly and could have headed Palace in front on 15 minutes but his effort bounced behind off a Zrinjski defender.

So when Daichi Kamada’s golden chance ricocheted wide, no doubt plenty were wondering whether this was going to be one of those nights.



BEST ONLINE CASINOS – TOP SITES IN THE UK

The first murmurings of frustration from the stands came after half an hour as Palace had nothing to show for 73 per cent possession and a 6-0 shot count.

And the fans grew increasingly annoyed at Portuguese referee Luis Godinho, who was certainly not living up to his name in their eyes.

But, ironically, the breakthrough came from a free-kick that did go their way on 36 minutes.

Wharton’s wicked delivery from the left whizzed to Lacroix at the back post and he gave goalkeeper Goran Karacic no chance, nodding home from four yards.



Huge sighs of relief around SE25.

Zrinjski rallied after the break but still did not threaten Dean Henderson on his 100th Palace appearance.

They did have the ball in the net but the flag was already up, moments after Chris Richards could not react to bundle in another sweet free-kick cross, this time from Kamada.



Sprawling Karacic denied Guessand with his face, Ismaila Sarr headed wide and Sarr somehow squandered a glorious one-on-one as the clock ticked agonisingly slowly to 90 and it remained dangerously 1-0.

But Guessand finally got the goal he deserved and the one to settle the nerves in the third minute of injury time.

He beat the offside trap and his low shot was too hot to handle, sneaking into the bottom corner.

And after four minutes added on, the Selhurst faithful were finally delighted to hear Godinho’s whistle one final time.



RECOMMENDED STORIES

Palace are still seven matches from getting their hands on a third piece of silverware in their 121-year history – and third in 13 months – come May.

Will grumbling Glasner deliver the perfect parting present after all?

Football.title: Roman Abramovich’s behaviour towards Chelsea legend Frank Lampard as manager leaves Lescott stunned – ‘that’s insane’
Football.content:
FORMER Chelsea star Jody Morris has revealed Frank Lampard did not have a single discussion with owner Roman Abramovich while manager.

The revelation stunned Premier League icon Joleon Lescott, who labelled the lack of contact “insane”.





Lampard, 46, boasts the second most Premier League appearances ever for Chelsea, behind John Terry.

But his certified legend status did not help him break the ice when he was brought back to the club years after his retirement in a new role as head coach.

Lampard stepped away from the club in 2014, but was hired half a decade later to steady the ship after Maurizio Sarri departed as manager.

But according to the former England man’s assistant coach Morris, 47, Lampard had no contact with club chairman Abramovich during his 18-months in charge between 2019 and early 2021.



Instead the assistant and former Blues midfielder claimed that club director Marina Granovskaia was the one running show.

Morris, who followed Lampard when he made the switch from Derby County to Stamford Bridge, opened up on their communication issues on the All Out Football podcast.

He said: “(Lampard) never had one conversation with Roman (Abramovich) the whole time he was there.

“The whole time when we went back there, Marina was running the club.



SUN VEGAS WELCOME OFFER: GET £50 BONUS WHEN YOU JOIN

“Frank Lampard is the manager of Chelsea and he never had one conversation with Roman as manager.”

Reports at the time of Lampard’s dismissal made similar claims, and reiterated Granovskaia’s importance in the club hierarchy.

A stunned Lescott chimed in: “You’re saying that now, I’m thinking’ that’s insane.”



Morris doubled down, adding: “He had conversations when he played for Chelsea, but then you come back as manager and they didn’t have one conversation, and he wanted to.”

Lampard led his side to fourth and an FA Cup final in his first season in the dugout.

But results took a nosedive in his second term and he was sacked in January 2021.

Subscribe to The Chelsea Blueprint on YouTube now

Despite the lack of contact, Abramovich released a message praising their “excellent personal relationship” upon the axe falling.

He wrote: “This was a very difficult decision for the club, not least because I have an excellent personal relationship with Frank and I have the utmost respect for him.



RECOMMENDED STORIES

“He is a man of great integrity and has the highest of work ethics. However, under current circumstances we believe it is best to change managers.

“On behalf of everyone at the club, the board and personally, I would like to thank Frank for his work as head coach and wish him every success in the future.”

Football.title: Newcastle plot transfer raid on Champions League rivals they thumped – but ownership quirk could scupper move
Football.content:
NEWCASTLE are reportedly monitoring Union Saint-Gilloise winger Anan Khalaili.

The Magpies could be at risk of losing Anthony Gordon at the end of the season, with multiple Premier League clubs interested.



With a potential transfer saga on the horizon, club officials are keeping tabs on possible attacking reinforcements.



And the Daily Mail has claimed that Khalaili is on their watchlist.

The 21-year-old winger has been talked about internally, with some top Newcastle scouts admiring him.

Recruitment chief Steve Nickson is among those who rate Khalaili highly.

The Israel international is viewed as a player of vast potential whose strongest attributes include his speed and technical ability.

In eight Champions League appearances this season, Khalaili has scored three goals, with two of those coming against Marseille in the league phase.

However, USG suffered a 4-0 loss to Newcastle just two months prior.

It is understood that Newcastle will scout across Europe to identify signings of value, with Belgium, France, Italy and the Netherlands among the places being looked at.

CASINO SPECIAL – BEST CASINO BONUSES FROM £10 DEPOSITS

With the club already having signed Anthony Elanga for £55million last summer, officials would only consider recruiting someone less expensive in that area during the next transfer window.



The main complication that could arrive should Newcastle attempt to sign Khalaili is the fact his club is part-owned by Brighton chairman Tony Bloom.

Bloom has a 25 per cent stake in Union Saint-Gilloise and therefore may be reluctant to allow the winger to join a rival Premier League club.

However, last summer Noah Sadiki was allowed to leave USG and join Sunderland in a £15m deal.

Football.title: When is Europa League last-16 draw? Date, start time, TV channel & FREE live stream as Aston Villa and Forest learn fate
Football.content:
ASTON VILLA and Nottingham Forest will find out their opponents in the last-16 of the Europa League on Friday.

Unai Emery‘s side finished second in the league phase, only behind Lyon on goal difference with 21 points.





Roma, Porto and Real Betis were among the other sides who qualified for the knockout stages automatically.

Nottingham Forest reached the last-16 by holding off a Fenerbahce fightback to win 4-2 on aggregate in their play-off encounter.

Celtic have been eliminated from the Europa league following their defeat by Stuttgart in the play-off round.

When is the Europa League draw?

The last-16 draw will take place on Friday, February 27.

It will take place at 12pm GMT, following the Champions League last-16 draw.

The draw will take place at the House of European Football in Nyon, Switzerland.

Where to watch the Europa League draw for FREE

The draw will be streamed live on Uefa.com, Uefa.tv and on the official Europa League app.

When will the Europa League last-16 matches be played?

Football.title: Ryan Yates suffers gruesome dislocated finger after awkward fall in Nottingham Forest vs Fenerbahce clash
Football.content:
NOTTINGHAM FOREST’S Ryan Yates suffered a gruesome finger injury in the opening minutes of their Europa League clash with Fenerbahce.

The midfielder was surely hoping for a calm game as Forest just had to hold on to their three-goal lead after an ideal opening leg of the tie in Turkey last week.





But that is not how things panned out.

The game was first disrupted by a flare being thrown onto the field of play, forcing the referee to call a halt to proceedings.

But things got even wilder after play restarted, as Yates landed awkwardly after a fall and picked up a horrifying injury.

His pinkie finger was seen bent at a grisly angle, apparently dislocated, with yates quickly ushering medical staff over.

He understandably appeared to be inconsiderable pain, and tried not to look at his broken digit.

The injury was so grim that TNT Sports elected not to broadcast a replay of the incident.

but despite that decision, fans watching on at home reacted to the injury to the Riverside fan-favourite.

One said: “I knew Ryan Yates had forest in his bones, I didn’t need him to try and show me proof mid-match.”



SUN VEGAS WELCOME OFFER: GET £50 BONUS WHEN YOU JOIN

Another joked about his tough reaction to the injury, saying: “Ryan Yates just giving the bench a quick wave.”

But incredibly club-captain Yates was not substituted as a result of his injury.

The 28-year-old went to the side of the pitch to have the finger treated and strapped into place, before making a return to the field.

Another fan added: “Ryan Yates dislocating his finger to a 90 degree angle and just having a smile about it then cracking on with the game.



“Hard as nails. Proper footballer. my captain.”

Unfortunately Yates’ determination meant he was on the pitch to see Forest concede the opening goal of the game.

Kerem Akturkoglu slotted past former Manchester City man Stefan Ortega to cut the aggregate scoreline down to 3-1 in Forest’s favour.

Akturkoglu struck again from the spot soon after the half-time break to put Forest fans’ hearts in their mouths.

But Callum Hudson-Odoi arrived to save the day for his side, with his 68th-minute finish sealing a 4-2 win for Vitor Pereira’s men on aggregate.

Football.title: Liverpool news: Trent Alexander-Arnold Anfield return feelings clear as reunion confirmed
Football.content:
Liverpool news: Trent Alexander-Arnold Anfield return feelings clear as reunion confirmed

Liverpool's Champions League fate is imminent as Trent Alexander-Arnold opens up on his hopes of winning the competition

View 3 Images Trent Alexander-Arnold reflects on Real Madrid win over Benfica (Image: TNT Sports)

Liverpool's Champions League pathway is about to reveal itself with some mouth-watering ties lying in wait. The Reds finished third in the league phase, securing their passage to the knock-out rounds.

‌



The Reds will now face either a reunion with Atletico Madrid or Galatasaray in the last-16. Both sides are capable of inflicting damage on Arne Slot's side as demonstrated this season alone.

‌



Liverpool famously beat Atletico 3-2 at Anfield in November with the Spanish giant's manager, Diego Simeone, sent off. Liverpool were also beaten by Galatasaray away from home in September.

‌



Ensure our latest sport headlines always appear at the top of your Google Search by making us a Preferred Source. Click here to activate or add us as Preferred Source in your Google search settings

Each game offers Liverpool a route that could see them meet Real Madrid, and former player Trent Alexander-Arnold, in the latter rounds. Mirror Football takes a look at Alexander-Arnold's feelings on returning to the Reds while Simeone has also shared his thoughts on playing Liverpool.

Trent Alexander-Arnold's feelings clear

Speaking after Real Madrid dispatched Benfica to claim their place in the last-16, Alexander-Arnold made his feelings clear that he and his team are ready for any challenge that comes their way.

‌



Red Bull break silence on Jurgen Klopp quit claims after Man Utd job offer leaked READ MORE :

Trent Alexander-Arnold slammed by Spanish media as Real Madrid reality sets in READ MORE :

Alexander-Arnold has already returned to Liverpool once this season, with Slot's side beating Los Blancos 1-0 in November. The ex-Reds full-back started the game on the bench but was met with a chorus of boos as he made his way to the pitch late in the second half.

Liverpool and Madrid could now meet each other again, in the semi-finals or final, depending on who the Reds draw in the last-16. The England defender isn't fearful of meeting his old side, however, declaring there is no reason why Madrid shouldn't go on to claim their 16th European Cup.

View 3 Images Alexander-Arnold played 90 minutes against Benfica (Image: Quality Sport Images, Getty Images)

‌



"It wasn't about sending a message to anyone, it was about winning the game and letting our football do the talking," Alexander-Arnold said.

"At the start of every season, our aim is to win this competition. We know the importance of it, for the club and for the fans and we know what it means with the club being the most successful in this competition.

"There's an expectation and demand. There's no reason why we can't go on and win it. We're more than ready to face whatever challenges come next."

‌



Reunion on the cards

Whoever Liverpool draw, be it Atletico or Galatasaray, a reunion is on the cards with either Atletico or Galatasaray. Goals from Mohamed Salah, Andy Robertson and a late winner from Virgil van Dijk ensured the Reds beat Atletico 3-2 in a heated affair at Anfield in September.

It was a game memorable for a stunning meltdown from Atletico boss Simeone that saw him receive a red card. After beating Club Brugge to cement Atletico's place in the last-16, Simeone even claimed he is “not thinking about Liverpool”.

Liverpool have played Atletico nine times since 2008. The Reds have won four of those ties, drawn two and lost three. Simeone's side have eliminated Liverpool on the two occasions the clubs have met in European knock-out competition: back in 2020 in the Champions League and in the 2010 Europa League semi-finals.

‌



View 3 Images Diego Simeone was sent off against Liverpool earlier this season (Image: Marc Atkins/Getty Images)

Liverpool have faced Galatasaray on five occasions in European competition. The Reds have won just one of those encounters, losing two and drawing two.

FOLLOW OUR LIVERPOOL FB PAGE! Latest Reds news and more on our dedicated Facebook page

‌



Just as with Atletico, the Reds have already played Galatasaray this season, losing a frustrating contest at the Ali Sami Yen in September by a single goal - a penalty slotted by Victor Osimhen.

You would have to go back to 2006 to find Liverpool's last win over the Turkish side. That was a 3-2 win at the Ataturk Stadium with Liverpool then reigning European Champions under Rafael Benitez.

Football.title: Man Utd news: Player's transfer request 'rejected' as Cristiano Ronaldo buys stake in club
Football.content:
Man Utd news: Player's transfer request 'rejected' as Cristiano Ronaldo buys stake in club

Manchester United have continued pushing for Champions League qualification and could have a busy time ahead during the summer transfer window

View 2 Images Cristiano Ronaldo at Al Nassr (Image: Waleed Zein/Anadolu via Getty Images)

While some Premier League teams have been in European action this week, Manchester United have been able to take a watching brief. Weekend opponents Crystal Palace took on Zrinjski Mostar in the second leg of their Conference League play-off, leaving them with less rest going into their match at Old Trafford.

‌



If Michael Carrick's side can take advantage and pick up three points, it would move them one step closer to a top-four finish. Closest challengers Chelsea and Liverpool will play either side of United, with Arne Slot's Reds hosting West Ham on Saturday and Liam Rosenior's Blues facing league leaders Arsenal in Sunday's later game.

‌



Carrick's own future could rest on whether he can solidify the progress he has made so far. United have 16 points from a possible 18 under the interim boss and have seemingly benefited from fresh legs while rivals deal with a busier fixture list.

‌



In today's round-up, our focus moves onto the summer transfer window and the moves the club will and won't be making. Here's the latest from around Old Trafford.

Ensure our latest sport headlines always appear at the top of your Google Search by making us a Preferred Source. Click here to activate or add us as Preferred Source in your Google search settings

Marcus Rashford's Barcelona dream transfer at risk as Premier League return twist tipped READ MORE :

Onana request to be denied

Manchester United have no intention of reintegrating goalkeeper Andre Onana next season, according to TeamTalk. The Cameroon international is currently on loan at Trabzonspor but is not expected to stay with the Turkish club beyond the end of the current campaign.

‌



The club are said to be keen to get Onana's wages off the books, with Senne Lammens now established as the first-choice keeper at Old Trafford. Reports indicate they will reject Onana's request to prove himself back at Old Trafford and look to sell him on - even if that means taking a hit on the £47m they paid Inter Milan to sign him in 2023.

Mainoo contract risk

View 2 Images Kobbie Mainoo in Manchester United training (Image: Ash Donelon/Manchester United via Getty Images)

United remain at risk of allowing Kobbie Mainoo to enter the final year of his contract without an agreement in place to extend his deal. That's according to The Sun, who report that player and club have yet to reopen talks over a new deal.

‌



Mainoo is understood to have rejected an offer from United towards the end of the 2024/25 season. He found minutes hard to come by under Ruben Amorim and was linked with a January exit, but has reestablished himself as a starter under Carrick.

United do still hold a one-year extension option on Mainoo's deal, which expires in the summer of 2027. However, they are said to still be planning talks over a longer deal for the academy graduate, even if talks with the player's representatives haven't been reopened after the standstill in 2025.

Ronaldo's new investment

Content cannot be displayed without consent

‌



Former Manchester United star Cristiano Ronaldo has made a 25 per cent investment in Spanish club Almeria through his CR7 Sports Investments venture. The club, who are majority owned by Saudi consortium SMC Group, are currently pushing for promotion to La Liga.

"It has been a longtime ambition of mine to contribute to football, beyond the pitch," the 41-year-old said in a statement. "UD Almeria is a Spanish club with strong foundations and clear potential for growth. I look forward to working alongside the leadership team to support the club's next phase of growth."

Football.title: Luis Enrique agreement reached as Man Utd told Michael Carrick dismissal would be 'criminal'
Football.content:
Luis Enrique agreement reached as Man Utd told Michael Carrick dismissal would be 'criminal'

Michael Carrick has enjoyed a great start to this spell as Manchester United boss and is yet to lose, having overseen six matches

View 2 Images Jody Morris has had his say on the Manchester United job and Michael Carrick (Image: In The Mixer)

Jody Morris reckons Manchester United simply have to give Michael Carrick the manager's job permanently if he continues to impress. The ex-Chelsea player and coach also has his say on the possibility of hiring Luis Enrique.

‌



After Ruben Amorim's dismissal, ex-United midfielder Carrick was handed the reins at Old Trafford until the end of the season. And he has started with great aplomb, not losing any of these first six games in charge and winning five.

‌



Morris, who worked as a coach under Frank Lampard at Stamford Bridge, earned his badges alongside Carrick and thinks he should be handed the role for good come the summer if he keeps up this rich vein of form.

‌



One manager mooted as a possible rival to Carrick for the position is current Paris Saint-Germain boss Luis Enrique. Morris also had his say on this prospect.

You can listen to brand new episodes of In The Mixer on Spotify and Apple Podcasts!

"Carrick has been unbelievable," said Morris, speaking on In The Mixer brought to you by Sky Bet. "I was moaning about Ruben Amorim. I just couldn't have what he was doing. How can you not play Kobbie Mainoo?

‌



Man Utd legend urges club to make Harry Maguire future decision amid contract dilemma READ MORE :

"I have a lot of time for Michael Carrick. He was on my Pro Licence course and I've been on a few League Managers' Association things with him.

"He's an astute student of the game. Straight away, he comes in and Kobbie Mainoo's in there and he's been brilliant. It would be criminal not to give him the job if he carries on.

View 2 Images Enrique is one of many managers who has been linked with the United job (Image: Getty)

‌



"I'm always up for young English coaches getting the job. And I think he's done an outstanding job so far. The fans are loving him as well. There's a real feel-good factor around Man United which hasn't been there for a long time."

Morris was then asked if he'd take PSG boss Enrique over Carrick were he available in the summer. He replied: "I'd still go with Carrick, because I honestly don't think Luis Enrique would come to Man United."

Article continues below

Former Manchester City defender Joleon Lescott agreed. He said: "I don't know if Enrique goes there now because I don't think he sees them as genuine contenders.

"I think Carrick should get the job because I don't know if Enrique helps them to become contenders. I think Carrick definitely does that. I think he has a stronger connection to the club, the fans, everything to help them get to that stage."

Football.title: Arsenal news: Viktor Gyokeres demand sent as replacement for £50m star on transfer radar
Football.content:
Arsenal news: Viktor Gyokeres demand sent as replacement for £50m star on transfer radar

Arsenal news round-up as Viktor Gyokeres is told what he needs to do and the Gunners are linked with a highly-rated star

View 2 Images Viktor Gyokeres has been told to up his game (Image: Getty Images)

Arsenal are on the up again as they prepare for Sunday's showdown with Chelsea. The Gunners delivered the perfect response to their recent wobble by thrashing Tottenham last weekend.

‌



Viktor Gyokeres and Eberechi Eze both scored twice to secure a 4-1 triumph just four days after Arsenal were rocked by a 2-2 draw at Wolves. The dropped points at Molineux led to questions about their title mentality. However, their performance against Spurs - which took them five points clear of Manchester City at the top of the Premier League - went some way to silencing the doubters.

‌



Next up is a Chelsea side battling to secure Champions League football in another season of upheaval at Stamford Bridge, with Liam Rosenior replacing the sacked Enzo Maresca. Mirror Football brings you a round-up of the latest Arsenal news…

‌



Gyokeres demand

Gyokeres has been told he needs to do more against Arsenal's main rivals. The Swede's rollercoaster debut season with the Gunners took a turn in the right direction with his brace in the north London derby.

MAKE THE MIRROR YOUR FIRST CHOICE! Click here to activate or add us as Preferred Source in your Google search settings

However, Arsenal legend Anders Limpar says his countryman can't just find the net against "awful" defences like Spurs'. Gyokeres hasn't found the net against the Manchester clubs or Liverpool this season, although Limpar accepts his team-mates have a role to play in that too.

‌



Arsenal told team that can stop them winning the Champions League ahead of last 16 draw READ MORE :

The former winger told Bettingsidor.se : "He's struggling in some games because players like Saka, Trossard and Odegaard don't look to find Viktor. They haven't quite worked each other out yet, so he's struggled.

"When he gets more of the ball, his touch is good and he wants to receive it, so I think Arsenal have to find Viktor more, even when playing Liverpool or Manchester City, who are the top teams.

FOLLOW OUR ARSENAL FB PAGE! Latest Gunners news and more on our dedicated Facebook page

‌



"When playing an awful defensive team like Tottenham, he looked really, really good. So they have to be patient and see what he can do against Chelsea and build on that.

"It’s not heaven or hell here. We have to be patient and let him grow into the team. For some players, it takes a little longer, but he was unbelievable against Spurs."

View 2 Images Ben White could be on his way out of Arsenal in the summer (Image: Stuart MacFarlane/Arsenal FC via Getty Images)

‌



White replacement option

Arsenal are reportedly among a clutch of clubs interested in Eintracht Frankfurt right-back Nnamdi Collins. With Ben White playing second fiddle to Jurrien Timber and potentially on his way out of the club this summer, the Gunners are on the lookout for a potential long-term replacement.

Collins has been catching the eye with his performances, establishing himself as one of the Bundesliga's most promising defenders. Arsenal are not the only club interested in the 22-year-old, who, like White, can also operate in the heart of defence.

Manchester City, Newcastle, Brentford and Brighton are also watching Collins, reports TEAMtalk. Meanwhile, White, 28, who cost the Gunners £50million when he arrived from Brighton in 2021, has been linked with a move to Barcelona, per reports in Spanish media.

Football.title: Cristiano Ronaldo sent transfer request after buying 25 per cent stake in club
Football.content:
Cristiano Ronaldo sent transfer request after buying 25 per cent stake in club

Cristiano Ronaldo has entered the world of football club ownership after buying a stake in Spanish side Almeria - and now the 41-year-old has been offered a new role

View 2 Images Cristiano Ronaldo has a stake in Almeria (Image: Yasser Bakhsh/Getty Images)

Cristiano Ronaldo has taken a step towards a new career in football by becoming a club owner, but his services as a player are still in demand. The 41-year-old Al-Nassr forward announced on Thursday that he had purchased a 25 per cent stake in Spanish club Almeria.

‌



Ronaldo has joined a growing group of players to dip into ownership, including fellow current and former Real Madrid alumni Luka Modric, Vinicius Junior, Thibaut Courtois and Kylian Mbappe. He has put his money into Spanish second division side Almeria via CR7 Sports Investments.

‌



"It has been a longtime ambition of mine to contribute to football, beyond the pitch," Ronaldo wrote in a statement. "UD Almeria is a Spanish club with strong foundations and clear potential for growth. I look forward to working alongside the leadership team to support the club's next phase of growth."

‌



Almeria are third in the Spanish second division, just two points off top spot and challenging for promotion to La Liga. And manager Rubi didn't waste any time in appealing to Ronaldo to join his team after his investment was confirmed.

JOIN US ON FACEBOOK! Latest news, analysis and much more on Mirror Football's Facebook page

Benfica release new statement after claims Gianluca Prestianni admitted Vinicius Jr racism READ MORE :

"We are very happy. Obviously, we welcome him," he said. "I think it's excellent news because someone like him, with his one hundred per cent knowledge of sport and football, can help a club like ours. It's very exciting for the whole club and for the city.

‌



"You already know the good relationship Cristiano has with the owners. One learns about some things, but I don't think it's important when I found out or stopped finding out. The important thing is that he's landing here with us. We are very happy.

"It would be extraordinary and wonderful if he could play here, but that's a question for him. This is his club and, if he wanted to continue playing, whoever the coach is, he would be received with open arms. I have no doubt about that."

MAKE THE MIRROR YOUR FIRST CHOICE! Click here to activate or add us as Preferred Source in your Google search settings

‌



View 2 Images Cristiano Ronaldo is still committed to Al-Nassr (Image: Yasser Bakhsh, Getty Images)

President Mohammed Al-Khereiji added: "[Ronaldo] is regarded as the greatest to ever play the game, he knows the Spanish leagues very well and he understands the potential of what we are building here both in terms of the team and the academy."

Ronaldo recently went through a sticky path at Al-Nassr, going on strike in protest at the lack of investment in the January transfer window from the owners. He has since made up with the Saudi Arabian Public Investment Fund (PIF) and is under contract with Al-Nassr until June 2027, where he's paid £177million per year - a bit beyond Almeria's budget.

‌



"I'm very happy," Ronaldo told Saudi broadcaster Thmanyah recently. "As I say so many times, I belong to Saudi Arabia. It's a country that has welcomed me very well, and my family and my friends. I'm happy here, I want to continue here.

"The most important thing is we keep pushing [for the league title], we are there at the top. We do our job, we win, make pressure, let's see at the end of the season."

Football.title: Jesse Lingard in line for shock Man Utd reunion after latest transfer twist
Football.content:
Jesse Lingard in line for shock Man Utd reunion after latest transfer twist

Jesse Lingard has been linked with clubs from the Premier League and Serie A but is now on the cusp of sealing a move to one of Brazil's most famous football teams

View 2 Images Jesse Lingard is in advanced talks over a move to Corinthians (Image: Zhizhao Wu)

Jesse Lingard is now in advanced talks with Corinthians over a one-year deal after previously discussing a move to their divisional rivals, Remo.

‌



The former Manchester United and England attacker, 33, is a free agent after leaving FC Seoul back in December. And Lingard looks poised to continue playing overseas with strong interest in his services from Brazil, first from Remo and now Corinthians.

‌



ESPN Brazil report that Lingard and Corinthians are attempting to close a deal which would see the winger join them. It is noted that 'financial issues' have been resolved and that the club are now working to wrap up the final aspects of the proposed agreement.

‌



If Lingard does put pen to paper with Corinthians then he would line up alongside a familiar face in the former Manchester United forward, Memphis Depay.

MAKE THE MIRROR YOUR FIRST CHOICE! Click here to activate or add us as Preferred Source in your Google search settings

Lingard, a product of the Manchester United academy, played alongside Depay during the 2015-16 season, though the Netherlands international fell out of favour soon after and was sold to Lyon in January 2017.

‌



While Depay's time at Old Trafford was short and sweet, Lingard clocked up years of service, making 385 appearances for the Red Devils and scoring 77 goals in total.

It had been reported earlier this year that Lingard had held talks with Premier League clubs over a possible return to England, while there was also strong Serie A interest in the attacker's services.

View 2 Images Lingard will reunite with his former Man United team-mate Memphis Depay if he joins Corinthians (Image: Mike Hewitt)

‌



With Lingard seemingly all but certain to continue his career overseas, the winger, who scored 10 goals in 34 games during his final K League season with FC Seoul, previously explained that a desire to 'feel loved' was the driving force behind his decision to move to South Korea.

“When looking for my next club it felt important to go somewhere I was loved and appreciated and, after I returned to Manchester, FC Seoul sent two of their main people all the way there just to watch me train and play in a five-a-side game,” he said.

“The idea of Korea grabbed me. Not just a different challenge, but a new environment and culture. FC Seoul is one of the biggest clubs in the K League, with a fantastic stadium, so I said yes.”

Football.title: Benfica release new statement after claims Gianluca Prestianni admitted Vinicius Jr racism
Football.content:
Benfica release new statement after claims Gianluca Prestianni admitted Vinicius Jr racism

Benfica have issued a new statement to explain the stance of Gianluca Prestianni after he was suspended by UEFA following allegations he racially abused Real Madrid's Vinicius Junior

View 2 Images Gianluca Prestianni allegedly racially abused Vinicius Jr (Image: Soccrates Images, Getty Images)

Benfica have denied that Gianluca Prestianni admitted to his team-mates that he had racially abused Real Madrid star Vinicius Junior. Prestianni was suspended for the second leg of their Champions League tie against Real on Wednesday night after UEFA launched an investigation into the allegations.

‌



Real progressed into the last 16 of the Champions League 3-1 on aggregate in a tie that was marred by an incident in the first leg in Portugal. Vinicius reported to the referee that Prestianni had used a racial slur after he had opened the scoring and been booked for his celebrations.

‌



The Benfica player publicly denied the allegations afterwards, saying his opponent had "misinterpreted" what he'd said after pulling his shirt over his mouth. However, Portuguese media have reported that the 20-year-old later admitted his guilt to his team-mates and apologised.

‌



Benfica have now released a new statement to address those claims. It reads: "Sport Lisboa e Benfica categorically denies that the player Prestianni has communicated to the squad or the club's structure that he has uttered a racist insult to the player Vinicius Jr, from Real Madrid.

JOIN US ON FACEBOOK! Latest news, analysis and much more on Mirror Football's Facebook page

Premier League slammed over Man City 115 charges verdict delay as La Liga chief lets rip READ MORE :

"As has already been made public, the player apologised to his teammates for the incident that occurred during the match against Real Madrid, regretting the dimension and consequences of it and assuring everyone, as he has done since the first hour, that he is not racist."

‌



In his original post on social media, Prestianni said: "I want to clarify that at no time did I direct racist insults at the player Vinicius Junior, who unfortunately misinterpreted what he thought he heard. I have never been racist and I regret the threats I received from Real Madrid players."

UEFA suspended the Argentine for the second leg and is investigating. He could be banned for 10 matches if found guilty.

MAKE THE MIRROR YOUR FIRST CHOICE! Click here to activate or add us as Preferred Source in your Google search settings

‌



View 2 Images Gianluca Prestianni is alleged to have racially abused Vinicius Junior (Image: Angel Martinez/Getty Images)

In response to UEFA's decision, Benfica wrote in a statement: "The club regrets being deprived of the player while the process is still under investigation and will appeal this UEFA decision, even though the deadlines in question are unlikely to have any practical effect on the second leg of the Champions League play-off.

"Benfica also reaffirms its unwavering commitment to combating all forms of racism or discrimination, values that are part of its historical identity and are reflected in its daily actions, its global community, the work of the Benfica Foundation, and major figures in the club's history, such as Eusébio."

‌



Vinicius has been supported by his club and scored in the second leg to help Real progress. He wrote on social media: "Racists are, above all, cowards. They need to put their shirts over their mouths to demonstrate how weak they are. But they have the protection of others who, theoretically, have the obligation to punish them.

"Nothing that happened here is new in my life or my family's. I received a yellow card for celebrating a goal. I still don't understand why. On the other hand, it was just a poorly executed protocol that served no purpose. I don't like appearing in situations like this, especially after a great victory when the headlines have to be about Real Madrid, but it's necessary."

Football.title: Mauricio Pochettino breaks silence on links to Tottenham job with telling comment
Football.content:
Mauricio Pochettino breaks silence on links to Tottenham job with telling comment

Tottenham will be on the hunt for a new manager this summer with Mauricio Pochettino breaking his silence on a potential return

View 2 Images Mauricio Pochettino has been speaking about a potential return to Tottenham (Image: (Photo by Julio Aguilar/Getty Images))

Mauricio Pochettino has seemingly left the door open on a return to Tottenham. The former Spurs boss will lead the United States of America at their home World Cup this summer, but beyond that campaign, he could be back in the Premier League and has not ruled it out in a recent interview.

‌



Pochettino, who managed Spurs between 2014 and 2019, remains hugely popular with the fanbase and is one of several big names linked with the job on a permanent basis. The club are currently in crisis and battling relegation, with former Juventus manager Igor Tudor taking over as interim manager following Thomas Frank's axing.

‌



Pochettino is set to lead the USA at this summer's World Cup but has refused to rule out a return to his old club, hinting that he's open to all offers.

‌



During a radio interview with “Radiogaceta de los Deportes” on RNE in Spain, he said: “I’m always linked (to clubs), to Tottenham, just like at one time I was linked to Espanyol, or to other clubs. In the end, especially because of my past at those clubs, when things aren’t going well, people tend to fall back on emotions and say, ‘Well, with Mauricio we played good football,’ or whatever it may be.

"But no. We’re focused on the World Cup, on the United States. My contract runs until after the World Cup, so after that we’ll see what might happen. Open to everything, right?”

Ian Wright and Gary Neville clash as Igor Tudor forced to deny worrying Tottenham theory READ MORE :

Tudor took over earlier this month on an interim basis until the end of the season with the sole aim of avoiding relegation.

‌



He replaced Frank, who was sacked earlier this month, having managed just two wins from 17 Premier League games. Spurs are also yet to win in 2026.

JOIN US ON FACEBOOK! Latest news, analysis and much more on Mirror Football's Facebook page

That continued this past weekend with defeat to Arsenal in the north London Derby, which saw the gap to the bottom three reduced to four points following West Ham's draw against Bournemouth.

‌



Pochettino is seemingly the leading contender to be Frank's permanent successor with Spurs in need of a head coach who can galvanise the fanbase.

Though he did not win any trophies, the Pochettino years are reflected upon fondly with Tottenham going close in two Premier League title races. They also reached the Champions League final in 2019, but lost to Liverpool.

Pochettino was sacked just months after that showpiece clash with Spurs appointing Jose Mourinho as his replacement. Nuno Espirito Santo, Antonio Conte, Ange Postecoglou and Frank have followed as permanent managers since then.

‌



View 2 Images Tottenham sacked Thomas Frank earlier this month (Image: Joe Toth/Shutterstock)

Roberto De Zerbi, Robbie Keane and Enzo Maresca have been touted as possible alternatives to Pochettino.

Other big names such as Julian Nagelsmann and Carlo Ancelotti could also be available after the World Cup, but Manchester United are more likely to appoint one of those.

Article continues below

What division Tottenham are in next season will likely play a huge role in the type of candidate they can appoint. If he does not get the permanent job at Old Trafford, Michael Carrick, who also played for Spurs, is a serious option.
